Description: Rim sherd (mended from three) of Chian, probably Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; alternating lotus flower and palmette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: at rim, broken maeander band between two black lines; below, pendant decoration and rosette as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 99, pl. XXXII, no. 302.12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0601) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 211, no. 9)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5991 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
